N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 27.6 - Family planning services

State Regulations
(a) Availability. The staff of facilities operated by the Department of

Mental Hygiene and the staff of facilities receiving State funds through the
department shall arrange for the availability of family planning services for
all patients and shall make known to such patients the existence of these
services. (1)

Any patient has the
right to receive, upon request, information about contraception. (2)
A patient who is 16 years of age or
older, or who is the parent of a child, or who has married has the right to
receive, upon his or her request, drugs or devices designated to regulate
conception. (3)

Any patient under
16 years of age, who is unmarried and is not the parent of a child, requesting
such drugs or devices may receive them at the discretion of the facility staff
which should consult with the patient's parent or legal guardian whenever
practicable. (b) Sterilization. Sterilization shall not be performed in any case until
reviewed and approved by a medical review board independent of the facility
appointed by the regional director. (c) Pregnancy. Each patient has the same right to carry a pregnancy to
term as any other citizen. Moreover, each patient has the same right to
abortion as any other citizen; and it is the responsibility of the director and
staff of facilities to make every effort to see that procedures for abortion
are made available in accordance with existing law. Notes
